Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Kmscott105
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed here for a hen party, and was disgusted to find bed bugs in the beds and on the walls, floor and ceiling of the apartments. My friends and I were bitten by these bugs, we were then cover in red itchy lumps!! We were offered no compensation or apology from the owners (who actually suggested that we might have brought the bed bugs with us in our suitcase!!) in short don't stay here!!! My experience of these apartments actually put me of Amsterdam!! I can honestly say I won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “Large for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RottenRonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of 17 people celebrating a 50th Birthday and found The Monk catered to all our needs. Our diverse group covered the ages from 14 to 70 and the Nieuwmarket covered all possible needs from supermarket, market stalls, cafes and a coffee shop right on the corner :) I have been visiting Amsterdam for 35 years and the apartments are the largest accommodations I have ever seen in Amsterdam and larger than most surrounding homes. Most of the apartments have access to a balcony and our one bedroom apartment had two. The other main attraction is the location with lots of atmosphere and plenty to see. If you handle the stairs the penthouse has the best views and is a great space which we put to good use and had a cocktail party for 20 people. The bedroom door is a good laugh and is hung upside down and larger than the door frame. The front rooms overlooking the street and the first floor apartment seemed to be the only ones without access to a balcony. Must mention that whilst the balconies are a great spot to chill they are surrounded by residents who are quick to complain about any noise after 10pm. We were reprimanded 3 times but they did not realise we were from the same group otherwise I think they would have caused more trouble for us. It was around 10:30pm and we were not using foul language just laughing a lot but were threatened with the police. In summary The Monk was a casually managed complex with large well equipped apartments, in a great location and great value. Certainly deserves a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MyDadisAJournalist
Reviews.Content: Would like to say that this place definitely exceeded our expectations. We travelled in a group of 3. Did not really want to stay in a hostel, however we were in luck when we secured accomodation here. We actually came during a busy time as there was some Congress happening and alot of accomodation was fully booked for the week. We only stayed here for 2 nights but was definitely worth it. Convenience along with luxury best described our experience here. Cant spot any faults here as everything here was prestine. Clean rooms, bathooms, living room and we also had our own veranda.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely owner, nice apartment.”
Reviews.Author: BetsyGolightly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 6-10th December 2010 with my boyfriend (I know the review is a little late). The apartments are within walking distance of the station. You walk through (or behind) the Red Light District and through Chinatown right onto Nieuwmarkt Square. The square has a giant castle-looking building called In De Waag which is actually a restaurant. I went for dinner here on my 21st Birthday (in 2009) and it was PERFECT! The entire building was lit by candles and the food was to die for. Highly Recommended. When we went in 2010 we tried to book a table but it was full due to corporate events in the run up to Christmas. We ended up going to a tiny restaurant in the heart of the Red Light District called Blauw aan de Wal ... If you love food then this place is for you. You get a choice of a couple of meals on the menu and they come over and talk you through on your arrival.... It reminded me of these Michelin star restaurants you see on TV. We had fillet of hare which was divine! On arriving at the Monk Apartments you go in to Henks little office/studio and get the keys. You then go though to a separate entrance hall up some very steep stairs to the apartments. We booked the 1 bedroom, but he upgraded us to the 2 bedroom one. It was very spacious and clean (I'm very fussy and I couldn't fault it) with basic furniture. We also had a little balcony which overlooked some of the other apartments patios underneath. One thing I will say is that these apartments, like others in Amsterdam, are very old buildings... One reviewer mentioned mice. At the first apartments we stayed in (in 2009) which were much posher than these (but unfortunately are now private) we saw a couple of mice. The owner came and put some traps down etc. but sometimes you just have to accept there isn't a lot they can do due to the nature of the streets and buildings in Amsterdam. I never saw any at The Monk Apartments though. Our apartment had good facilities including dishwasher, comfy beds (although you get 2 separate duvets) and a very nice range cooker. The location is perfect, I don't know why people are so scared of The Red Light District, it has always felt very safe to me, possibly more safe than the quieter areas. It was minus 10 on our second day and the apartment was still lovely and cosy! I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We were not given the apartment we booked and paid for.”
Reviews.Author: christine_edwards
Reviews.Content: I would never commend that anyone stay there. Very angry that we did not get the apartment we booked over the Internet i.e City Comfort # 1. We got an inferior apartment with low ceilings at the top of the building. The first day there we cleaned. Fat in the frying pan, stained cups, thick layer of dust under bed, glass coffee table and glass dining table had muck all around the edges. Have to be fair though and say bathroom was clean. Only problem was no blind on large window in bathroom so exposed to those living in building across the lane. After complaining to Henk this was addressed. A towel was stapled to window frame. Also many items not supplied, .such as bedside tables, kitchen utensils, plug that fitted sink, power cord for stereo. All very frustrating and annoying when you've paid over 200 Euro a night. paid 200 Euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT !”
Reviews.Author: Shmulik79
Reviews.Content: The apartment was just perfect. The apartment we got is a lot larger than I expected (based on some pics I found online). Overall the apartment we got was very spacious. The service was great and very very friendly. The apartment was very clean, very well furnished, comfortable beds, nice shower. Cheaper than any hotel. More privacy than any hotel. Over all just super.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Kev_Hunter
Reviews.Content: Arrived at The Monk Apartments and although there was no-one there to meet us, there was a note on the door advising to call when we arrived. Henk arrived within 5 minutes of me calling him. We were a group of 6 guys and and although we had booked an apartment to sleep 6 this would have meant two guys sharing one double bed. Henk noticed this and offered us the 2 bedroomed apartment upstairs completely free of charge as it had not been booked for the length of our stay. Amazing!! He even came up shortly after with a set of keys for each of us. Less than 10 mins walk from Central Station, the apartments themselves are modern, clean and have all you could ask for. A maid arrived each day and really we just asked her to empty the bins and give fresh towels as this was all we needed. It is in a really fantastic location with the redlight light district within about 50 yards but far enough away so that you wouldn't even know. The beautiful Nieuwmarkt Square and Waag are about 20 yards in the opposite direction. Everything you need is truly right on your doorstep. I would not hesitate to return to these apartments and would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, great for groups”
Reviews.Author: RitzyGlitzy
Reviews.Content: This apartment is located in a great spot. Close to the station, close to Dam Square, and within walking distance to all the museums and sights. (very close to the red light district not sure if this is good or bad... suppose it depends on how you feel about it) The apartments are clean. They provide linen, towels, various teas and coffees and plenty of crockery and cutlery as well a dishwasher, kettle, and toaster. One problem though our oven wasn't working. There is a lovely restaurant at the end of the road called De Waag and the apratment manager is a lovely gentelman who was very helpful. They also provide you with a stereo, TV, iron and ironing board.

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly enjoyable as always”
Reviews.Author: roseaxl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the monk apartments for many years always seven times a year ,Jan,March.April.June.Aug.October and November.all the staff we have encountered have been friendly and helpful. we have stayed in most of the apartments over the years and found that they were all quiet ,very spacious and extremely clean. The area itself is vibrant. with a genuine feeling of being part of a safe community.I find it difficult to comprehend that the owner would place mousetraps on view for his clients to see! In all the times we have stayed there i have never seen a mousetrap or a mouse and as I live on a farm in rural Shropshire Im sure I would recognise one or have noticed mouse droppings!

Reviews.Title: “to "Never again"”
Reviews.Author: samiba
Reviews.Content: I am in Amsterdam on a project between 9th May and 13th June. i did not experience what you said in your comment. but we all need to understand these apartments are very old, about 400 to 500 years old. also considering garbage collectors in Amsterdam where on strike recently and these unit are in one of the busiest / dirtiest part of the city, such a experience is possible. to me any issue i had i just notice the staff and every thing fixed smoothly. I agree they may need to clean the units more frequently but this not a hotel, this is a serviced apartment. i think the rat, the noise and ... are a result of being in red light district rather than this specific apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: summer068
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends and our initial reaction was that it was very spacious and nice. That was until we spotted mouse traps in the kitchen..and then later that night we spotted the mice!there were about 5 altogether running around the kitchen which stayed for most of the weekend. Its a self catering apartment but could defo not eat out of it as it was a bit filthy. The morning we were to fly home i woke up with little red lumps all over me. Im told they are bed bug bites. Disgusting but true!! Im back three days now and they still havent cleared up. The only good things about it was the fact that there was a balcony so that we could smoke as it is not allowed in the apartment and the location was also good. I would defo go back to amsterdam again but will certainly not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “cozy”
Reviews.Author: yumsweets
Reviews.Content: we liked the apartment..nicely done up.We took the 2 bed apartment so it was not too small jus perfect size for us as we were 5.the bedrooms were cozy n the living area was good size too.kitchen was hooked up .the apt was jus a lil dusty but they sent a cleaning lady and got it done 4 us immediately.Its bang in the rld.we din have a problem with that tho...u can jus walk to dam and all the coffeeshops.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop view to die for but what's with the door?”
Reviews.Author: rachlikesrhythm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monk Apartments in September as a group of six friends. We booked and the stay over the internet and booked an apartment sleeping two in a double bed and an apartment sleeping 4 in a double and twin bedroom. We were told we had the Penthouse with a roof terrace (some of our party smoke and smoking in the apartments is not permitted - E500 fine for setting the fire alarms off!) When we arrived check-in was slow but the people in the office were very friendly. We were shown to our apartments but both were in separate buildings as it turned out some other guests had been given the Penthouse. A two-hour wait later they had been asked to move and we were shown to the top of the building. (A note on the first apartment - it was filthy, grot in the fridge, the only access to an outside area was through a bedroom and there is a chinese restaurant opposite that handles a lot of fish - not pleasant with the windows open) The 'Penthouse' was clean enough but I wouldn't recommend walking around with no shoes on! The contents of more than one emptied ashtray were strewn across the rooftop terrace, only half of the lightbulbs worked (don't try and change them - trust me - you'd need gloves to avoid the nasties) and the 'master bedroom' had a door that was too small for the door hole! Hence no privacy AT all. The twin bedroom also connected to the master room which is not ideal. I wouldn't recommend these apartments for people with mobility difficulties or families with children as the steps are very narrow and very steep. There are six or seven flights to the top floor. The building itself is very attractive and the decor in the penthouse is modern but with original features like the wooden floor and exposed beams. There is a fantastic view over the rooftops on the roof terrace and it is a great suntrap during the afternoon / early evening. The problem was that for a self-catering apartment the place just didn't feel clean enough to want to eat in it and for a property billed as 'luxury' we expected a lot more. I did email the apartments to suggest they consider adding doors that fit or have more than only 30% of lightbulbs working but have had no response. With a tiny bit more TLC the apartments could be stunning and might be worth the price we paid, but at the moment they are a little disappointing. PHOTOS - I didn't take many of inside the apartment but there are a few which give you an idea of what the terrace is like...

Reviews.Title: “love it .......... so chilled out.........”
Reviews.Author: inspironUk
Reviews.Content: brill place very good staff . so chilled out been 4 times now and back there in sept. forget hotels .....

HotelInfo.Name: The Monk Amsterdam Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Monnikenstraat 19 | 1012 BP, Amsterdam, The Netherlands
